tldr: `net-imap` is vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS) through memory exhaustion in its response parser. A malicious server can send highly compressed `uid-set` data at any time while the client is connected, which the client's receiver thread automatically processes. The response parser uses `Range#to_a` to expand `uid-set` data into arrays of integers without any limit on the expanded size, potentially leading to excessive memory consumption.
doest_this_affect_me: You are affected if you are using a version that falls within the vulnerable range.
how_to_fix: Upgrade the `net-imap` library to the patch version.
